dcterms:creator: Matthew Brown
David G. Lowe
dcterms:description: The UBC Phototour dataset consists of three subsets: Liberty, Notre Dame, and Yosemite, containing about 400k normalized 64x64 patches in each. Keypoints were detected by DoG detector and verified by a 3D model. The test set consists of 100k matching and non-matching pairs for each sequence.
dcterms:title: UBC Phototour (Brown dataset)

dcterms:creator: Vassileios Balntas
Karel Lenc
Andrea Vedaldi
Krystian Mikolajczyk
dcterms:description: HPatches is a dataset for local patch descriptor evaluation, consisting of 116 sequences of 6 images. It is split into two parts: viewpoint change and illumination change, with keypoints detected by various detectors and reprojected to the rest of the images.
dcterms:title: HPatches

dcterms:creator: Dmytro Mishkin
Jiri Matas
Michal Perdoch
Karel Lenc
dcterms:description: W1BS is a dataset consisting of 40 image pairs with significant changes in appearance, geometry, illumination, and sensor data. It is used for evaluating local features under extreme conditions.
dcterms:title: W1BS

dcterms:creator: James Philbin
Ondrej Chum
Michael Isard
Josef Sivic
Andrew Zisserman
dcterms:description: Oxford5k is a dataset for object retrieval containing 5062 images depicting 11 different landmarks along with distractors. It is used for evaluating image retrieval performance.
dcterms:title: Oxford5k

dcterms:creator: James Philbin
Ondrej Chum
Michael Isard
Josef Sivic
Andrew Zisserman
dcterms:description: Paris6k is a dataset for object retrieval containing 6300 images depicting various landmarks with distractors. It is used for evaluating image retrieval performance.
dcterms:title: Paris6k

dcterms:creator: R. Mitra
N. Doiphode
U. Gautam
S. Narayan
S. Ahmed
S. Chandran
A. Jain
dcterms:description: PhotoSync is a large dataset aimed at improving patch matching, containing various image patches for training and evaluation.
dcterms:title: PhotoSync
